lines.text: Ya can't go wrong in this town if you say Yep to the right people and Nope to the rest.
Now me, I never forget anything.

You know sheriff; we had an elephant in our carnival with a memory like that. He went after a keeper that he'd held a grudge against for almost 15 years. Had to be shot. You just wouldn't believe how much trouble it is to dispose of a dead elephant.
All sheriffs gotta wear this kind of hat. Otherwise, people wouldn't know they were the law.
I don't have to go like this, I've got better clothes.
I'm not a carnival girl anymore!
Sure been actin' like it with young Carlisle.

[Kisses Lane Bellamy, then holds her in an embrace while saying the following]
"I'm just crazy about you... what's your last name?"
It's kinda hard not to do your own worrying.
Well, I've gotta go do something official.
You know something? I bet you make a lousy sheriff.
A man going into the legislature should have a heart of gold and a respectable wife.
The only spring in the state guarantied to have no therapeutic value.
Just trying to do what's right. It must be right, otherwise it wouldn't be so hard to do.

[about Lane Bellamy]
I like her. And knowing you don't, makes me like her twice as much.
I never read the paper. If I don't know what's going on, I don't have to worry about it.
When I was very young, I made up my mind to be rich.
How'd you make out?
I thought it was better to change my mind.
I've never been able to make up my mind if you're awful smart, or awful stupid.

[about Sheriff Titus Semple]
Left alone, he'd steal the gold off the capital dome.
The only way to tell what a mule and a man can do, is to give him a field and a plow.
I plucked a goose here and there, but nobody could find a feather.
I don't think our form of government is so bad that honest men can't run it.
